intro: Gnaphalium armenium, commonly known as Armenian cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, fluffy flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pale yellow to white. Gnaphalium armenium is often found in open, sunny habitats and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
